tags.name: assets
tags.description: Allows users to get and edit configured assets from dbi

tags.name: ercot-override
tags.description: Allows users to get and override ERCOT standard variables

tags.name: events
tags.description: Allows users to get a list of filtered events

tags.name: scheduler
tags.description: Allows users to get, add, delete, and edit Scheduler events and modes, as well as get and edit the Scheduler configuration

tags.name: site
tags.description: Allows users to get, add, delete, and edit Scheduler events and modes, as well as get and edit the Scheduler configuration

tags.name: dashboards
tags.description: Allows users to get and edit configured dashboard cards from dbi

tags.name: fims
tags.description: Allows users to get a fims one-time-auth token, as well as send fims get, post, set, and delete messages

tags.name: layouts
tags.description: Allows users to get and edit configured layouts from dbi

tags.name: site-admins
tags.description: Allows users to get and edit site settings (password settings, radius settings), send radius tests

tags.name: users
tags.description: Allows users to get, add, edit, read, and delete users

tags.name: web-ui-config
tags.description: Allows users to get the full site configuration data object as well as a subset of config data used on the login page

username.description: HybridOS username - username must be between 5 and 25 characters; username may only include letters, numbers, periods, and underscores

old_passwords.description: List of previous user passwords, used for password expiration (when users password expires and certain password settings are set, they may not use new passwords that are in this list).

pwdUpdatedDate.description: Date that password was last updated.

username.description: HybridOS username - username must be between 5 and 25 characters; username may only include letters, numbers, periods, and underscores

multi_factor_authentication.description: Determines if multi-factor authentication is used

password_expiration.description: Determines if password expiration is enabled

password_expiration_interval.description: Time until password expires, in format length (numeric) interval (m - minutes, d -days); ex: 8d would mean 8 days

old_passwords.description: Number of previous passwords to disallow

lowercase.description: Determines if a lowercase letter is required in the password

uppercase.description: Determines if a uppercase letter is required in the password

digit.description: Determines if a digit is required in the password

special.description: Determines if a special character is required in the password

is_enabled.description: Determines if radius authentication is used

wait_time.description: Timeout length when connecting to radius server

is_local_auth_disabled.description: Deterimes if local authentication is disabled (only use radius)

multi_factor_authentication.description: Determines if multi-factor authentication is used

password_expiration.description: Determines if password expiration is enabled

password_expiration_interval.description: Time until password expires, in format length (numeric) interval (m - minutes, d -days); ex: 8d would mean 8 days

old_passwords.description: Number of previous passwords to disallow

lowercase.description: Determines if a lowercase letter is required in the password

uppercase.description: Determines if a uppercase letter is required in the password

digit.description: Determines if a digit is required in the password

special.description: Determines if a special character is required in the password

is_enabled.description: Determines if radius authentication is used

wait_time.description: Timeout length when connecting to radius server

is_local_auth_disabled.description: Deterimes if local authentication is disabled (only use radius)

wait_time.description: Timeout length when connecting to radius server

username.description: Username credential sent to test radius server

password.description: Password credential sent to test radius server

message.description: A response message describing whether or not the test of radius credentials passed or failed

token.description: Token for gaining access websocket gateway.

uri.description: The URI string associated with the message. All processes subscribed to this URI will receive the message.

replyto.description: Field containing another URI that receiver processes should send an acknowledgement message.

body.description: Optional body of the fims message; Typically either a single value or a stringified JSON object.

username.description: HybridOS username - username must be between 5 and 25 characters; username may only include letters, numbers, periods, and underscores

qrCode.description: URL of a qrcode to allow users to set up mfa

mfaRequired.description: Denotes whether further authentication steps are required

passwordExpired.description: Denotes whether the user's password has expired

username.description: HybridOS username - username must be between 5 and 25 characters; username may only include letters, numbers, periods, and underscores
HybridOS username - username must be between 5 and 25 characters; username may only include letters, numbers, periods, and underscores
HybridOS username - username must be between 5 and 25 characters; username may only include letters, numbers, periods, and underscores

message.description: Information on whether the logout was successful

assets.description: List of asset tabs from dbi.

alarmFields.description: Array of alarm fields associated with this asset

faultFields.description: Array of fault fields associated with this asset

inputType.description: Input type of a particular control

name.description: Name of a control, what is displayed to the UI

units.description: Unit used for a particular control

uri.description: URI associated with a particular control

name.description: Name of a status, what is displayed to the UI

uri.description: URI associated with a particular status

alarms.description: Array of information about alarms and faults associated with this asset

allControls.description: Array of all controls associated with this asset

controls.description: Array of controls associated with this asset

info.description: Array of info objects associated with this asset

statuses.description: Array of statuses associated with this asset

summary.description: Array of summary objects associated with this asset

summaryControls.description: Array of Summary Controls associated with this asset

layouts.description: List of layout tabs from dbi.

key.description: A reference key used with other configs, Typically should be relevant to the page

name.description: The name of the item, This will appear on the left side drawer of the UI as well as the relevant page.

icon.description: The icon to display in the drawer tab of the UI

info.description: Object containing info objects - each with a key and name

dashboards.description: List of dashboard tabs from dbi.

info.description: Information about the dashboard card itself

status.description: An array of statuses to display on the dashboard card

data.description: An array of data about a specific dashboard card

message.description: Information about message request or reply.
Information about message request or reply.
Information about message request or reply.
Information about message request or reply.

id.description: ID of repeat object associated with an Event

cycle.description: Cycle of repeat object - whether event recurs weekly or daily

frequency.description: Frequency of repeat object - how often an event recurs

day_mask.description: Day mask for repeat object of event that recurs weekly - which days event occurs

end_time.description: End date/time for repeating event - the date/time the event should stop recurring

end_count.description: End count for repeating event - after this number of events, the event should stop recurring

exceptions.description: Exceptions of the repeat object - the event will not occur on dates listed in this array

enabled.description: When true, Scheduler will send GETs to event setpoints during the duration of the event. If a value found in a GET reply does not match its setpoint value, a fresh SET will be sent to the setpoints URI.

frequency_seconds.description: How many seconds between setpoint enforcement GETs being sent out.

name.description: Display name of the local schedule

clothed_setpoints.description: True/False value representing whether to send setpoints as clothed body requests

setpoint_enforcement.description: Object used to configure the Setpoint Enforcement feature

id.description: The ID of the Site Scheduler. Used in URIs, so spaces and slashes are not allowed.

name.description: Display name of the Site Scheduler

ip.description: IP of the Site Schedulers server

port.description: The port that the Site Schedulers HTTPS WebSocket server is hosted on

enabled.description: When true, an HTTPS WebSocket will be served to which a Fleet Scheduler can connect

port.description: The port that the HTTPS WebSocket server should be hosted on.

clients.description: An array, where each element of the array is an object that represents a Site Scheduler

server.description: Fields associated with the server in the Fleet-Site interface

stage_size.description: The number of event slots in the Staging Area

max_num_configurations.description: The number of event slots the SCADA interface will maintain

num_floats.description: The number of float variables that will be represented per event slot

num_ints.description: The number of integer variables that will be represented per event slot

num_bools.description: The number of boolean variables that will be represented per event slot

num_strings.description: The number of string variables that will be represented per event slot

scheduler_type.description: Type of scheduler for configuration - FM (fleet manager) or SC (site controller)

local_schedule.description: Series of fields associated with the local schedule - optional on FM, required on SC

web_sockets.description: Object used to configure Fleet-Site interface feature

scada.description: Fields used to configure the SCADA interface to communicate with Scheduler over Modbus or DNP3

count.description: Count of total events matching filters

siteName.description: Label to display on the left hand side of the site status bar, comes from site_status.json config file

activeFaults.description: A count of the total number of active faults on the site, comes from /site/summary fims response, active_faults field

activeAlarms.description: A count of the total number of active alarms on the site, comes from /site/summary fims response, active_alarms field

siteState.description: The site status to display on the right hand side of the siste status bar, comes from /site/summary fims response, site_status field

baseData.description: Object containing data used on the site status bar

dataPoints.description: Object containing data points to display in the site status bar, comes from the site_status.json config file

data.description: Data object containing all information being passed to the Site Status Bar - label, active faults, active alarms, site status, and data points

value.description: New value for variable value (numeric values) or variable override flag (boolean values)

dependencies.description: A list of services which depend upon this service

serviceStatus.description: Status of the Service - Active, Failed, Initialized, Stopped - may include a substatus, ex: status (substatus)

connectionStatus.description: Connection Status for Service - Online or Offline

cpuUsage.description: Number representing CPU usage of Service as Percentage

memoryUsage.description: Number representing Memory usage of Service as Percentage

uptime.description: Number representing the service uptime (time that the service has been running)

lastRestart.description: Timestring representing the last time the service was restarted

actions.description: Array of actions (start, stop, restart) that a user can use for this service

method.description: Method to use to send message - either set, get, post, del, or pub.

uri.description: The URI string associated with the message. All processes subscribed to this URI will receive the message.

replyto.description: Field containing another URI that receiver processes should send an acknowledgement message.

body.description: Body of the fims message; Typically either a single value or a stringified JSON object.

username.description: Typically username of user who sent the fims message

timezone.description: The timezone to be utilized by the user interface, used to display the time in the top app bar

product.description: The HybridOS product - a product flag of SC or ESS will display HybridOS Control and a product flag of FM will display HybridOS Coordinate

ess.description: Whether or not to display the ESS page

gen.description: Whether or not to display the Generators page

solar.description: Whether or not to display the Solar page

met_station.description: Whether or not to display the Met Station page (deprecation)

tracker.description: Whether or not to display the Tracker page (deprecated)

feeders.description: Whether or not to display the Feeders page

features.description: Whether or not to display the Features page

site.description: Whether or not to display the Site page

events.description: Whether or not to display the Events page

control_cabinet.description: Whether or not to display the Control Cabinet page (deprecated)

fleet_manager_dashboard.description: Whether or not to display the Fleet Manager Dashboard page (deprecated)

scheduler.description: Whether or not to display the Scheduler page

units.description: An object containing the units to be used on the Configurable Asset Pages (generic) throughout the UI

site_name.description: The site name displayed in the Site Status Bar, App Bar, and the login page

fleet_name.description: Used to determine which fleet is using the UI, currently only being used to display the ERCOT Overrides Page (flag must be set to ERCOT)

site_status_bar.description: Whether or not to display the Site Status Bar component

system_status.description: Whether or not to display the System Status page

customer.description: Object containing information about the customer. Displayed on the login page of the UI.Contains sub fields for customer name and server name.

siteConfiguration.description: Site Configuration from web ui config file

product.description: Product type from site configuration found in web ui config file

customer.description: Customer name from site configuration found in web ui config file

siteName.description: Site name from site configuration found in web ui config file

server.description: Hardware/server name found in web ui config file
